citations.narrative:
A 1-year-old male Celebes Macaque is housed in an enclosure that does not meet minimum space requirements. The
macaque is exhibited outdoors in an enclosure that is 20 inches high and has a floor area that measures 30 inches by 18
inches. He is unable to fully stand and his exercise space is limited in this small enclosure. The exact weight of the
macaque is not known, but the licensee estimates him to be in the 6.6-22.0 pound range that would correspond to "Group
3" under this regulation. Group 3 animals require a minimum floor area of 4.3 square feet and a minimum enclosure
height of 30 inches. His current enclosure has 3.75 square feet of floor area and is only 20 inches high. For the physical
and psychological wellbeing of non-human primates, they must be provided adequate space to make normal behavioral
movements exercise, and play. The regulation establishes the minimum space requirements that must be met by the
exhibitor for this animal.
Correction date: July 23, 2025
This inspection was conducted with a facility representative and exit interview was conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.80(b)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
A 1-year-old male Celebes Macaque is housed in an enclosure that does not meet minimum space requirements. The 
macaque is exhibited outdoors in an enclosure that is 20 inches high and has a floor area that measures 30 inches by 18 
inches. He is unable to fully stand and his exercise space is limited in this small enclosure. The exact weight of the 
macaque is not known, but the licensee estimates him to be in the 6.6-22.0 pound range that would correspond to "Group 
3" under this regulation. Group 3 animals require a minimum floor area of 4.3 square feet and a minimum enclosure 
height of 30 inches. His current enclosure has 3.75 square feet of floor area and is only 20 inches high. For the physical 
and psychological wellbeing of non-human primates, they must be provided adequate space to make normal behavioral 
movements exercise, and play. The regulation establishes the minimum space requirements that must be met by the 
exhibitor for this animal.  
Correction date: July 23, 2025 
 
This inspection was conducted with a facility representative and exit interview was conducted with the licensee.
